items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:Approve First Interim Financial Report  2009-2010 First Interim Financial Report Qualified CertificationThese are unprecedented times in the history of California for public education funding.  Through the Federal American Recovery and Reinvestment Act and the Federal State Fiscal Stabilization Funds we have been able to offset drastic State Education Funding cuts retaining jobs and continue educating our students.  That having been said the projections for the subsequent years are more than bleak.  The 2009-2010 First Interim Financial Report projection next school year 2010-2011 shows the District will be able to meet its financial obligations but short by $6.4 million in State required unrestricted reserves.  In the 2011-2012 school year the projection indicates the District will be $12.7 million short in meeting its financial obligations.  Current State requirements obligate local school boards to certify the financial condition of the school district into one of three conditions which are:POSITIVE CERTIFICATION - …based upon current projections this district will be able meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year and subsequent two fiscal years.QUALIFIED CERTIFICATION - …based upon current projections this district may not meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year or two subsequent fiscal years.NEGATIVE CERTIFICATION - …based upon current projections this district will be unable to meet its financial obligations for the remainder of the fiscal year or for the remainder of the fiscal year or for the subsequent fiscal year.What the attached 2009-2010 First Interim Financial Report shows is that the District will be able to meet its financial obligations and reserve requirements for the current fiscal year plus meet the financial obligations but not the reserve requirement for the immediate subsequent year.  The report does project that the District may not be able to meet its financial obligations for the 2011-2012 fiscal year.  RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that given the current financial projections the Board of Trustees approve a Qualified Certification of the 2009-2010 First Interim Financial Report.

Hall & Associates submitted Project Inspector Selection Questionnaire forms but there was no response from Michael Henley & Associates.   Ultimately Bruce Flyn & Associates experience, availability and pricing were factors in the selection of this firm to provide these specialized services.RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve a contract services agreement with Bruce Flyn & Associates, Inc. in the amount not-to-exceed $96,096.00 for the contract term December 11, 2009 through and including March 30, 2011.2. Educational services shall be consistent with the master contract and specified services per the student’s Individual Education Program (IEP) plan. Reason for the Purchase of Outside Services:Due to the lack of appropriate articulation with the ESUHSD, Evergreen School District served a student since his first grade year at this school located in Santa Cruz, which specializes in the instruction of extremely involved Autistic students.  We are working with the parents to effect a change of placement at the semester to a more local NPS offering similar services.Selection Process: There was no competitive solicitation done for this service.  The Bay School was selected by Evergreen School District to meet this student’s needs in elementary school.  It is an NPS that offers specialized educational services for Autistic students. Overfelt, and Yerba Buena High SchoolsBettina Lopez, Ana Lomas, Lynne Murray, Grettel Castro-Stanley, Teresa Marquez, Carol Blackerby, Traci Williams, Thelma Boac, Vito Chiala, and Juan CruzEast Side Union High School District (ESUHSD) is requesting authorization from the Board of Trustees to accept grant funding from Agape Foundation and approve a contract services agreement with 180° LLC, for the contract term August 25, 2009 through and including June 30, 2010 and delegate authority to the Superintendent or designee to amend said contract, including funding, as needed.Purpose of the Grant:Agape Foundation has agreed to match ESUHSD’s commitment of $42,500 to pay for the 180 Degrees Program Services at  ten of our high schools: Andrew Hill, Evergreen Valley, Foothill, Independence, Mt. Pleasant, Oak Grove, Piedmont Hills, Silver Creek, W.C. Overfelt, and Yerba Buena.  ESUHSD shall administer and operate a full day comprehensive early childhood care and education service program for children whose families meet the Federal Income guidelines and other eligibility requirements of the Federal Head Start programs as outlined in the Federal Head Start Performance Standards.Reason for the Purchase of Outside Services:180°’s mission is to passionately help youth enhance their lives by accepting personal accountability and to continuously strive toward the goal of achieving their full potential, “one degree” at a time.  Their utilize comprehensive, research based and measurable approaches of intense instructional, participatory and interactive character and life skills education that is based upon 180°’s “Core Values.” They will always deliver these services in the most professional, innovative and highly effective manner.The intent of this program is to assist our at-risk students who are on the path of dropping out of school.   This curriculum based program targets five areas (Character Education -- Core Values -- 21st Century Skill --  Live Skills -- Community Outreach)  designed to assist youth establish goals and to examine critically behaviors, actions, and decisions.   The program also provides the foundation for a developing a sustainable professional development program for teachers.  The professional development program allows for consistency in training and support for teachers.Selection Process:This is a sole source vendor as there is no other vendor who provides this program.RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees Accept Grant Funding from Agape Foundation and Approve a Contract Services Agreement with 180° LLC, for the contract term August 25, 2009 through and including June 30, 2010 and delegate authority to the Superintendent or designee to amend said contract, including funding, as needed.5. GWSV has chosen Mt. Pleasant High School to be the school to receive the 21 Century High School ASSETs program.  As federally mandated, the California Department of Education gives competitive priority to high schools identified as in need of improvement under Title 1, Section 1116, of the NCLB Act. Additionally, ESUHSD will ensure that Mt. Pleasant High School meets funding eligibility requirements of having a Title I School wide Program (indicating a minimum of 40% Free and Reduced Price Meals) in addition to meeting Competitive Funding Priorities of having an API score of 3 or lower or be able to provide alternative measures of fully document and justify need.GWSV will act as lead managing agency for the 21st Century High School ASSETs grant; provide academic assistance, educational enrichment activities, family literacy referrals and resources and qualified staff to conduct these components; operate, on average, 15 hours per week, for 150 days during the academic school year; and all other duties as outlined in the agreement.Selection Process:N/ARECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve a revenue agreement with Goodwill of Silicon Valley (GWSV) for the contract term August 25, 2009 through and including June 30, 2010 and delegate authority to the Superintendent or designee to amend said contract, including funding, as needed.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and FacilitiesSUBJECT:Approve Project Scope Change to Provide for the Design of an Enhanced Performance Environment to Accommodate Visiting Theatrical Performances as Part of the Board Approved Scope of Work for the New Multipurpose/Classroom Building Project at Silver Creek High SchoolOn February 19, 2009 the Board approved a project budget to provide for the New Multipurpose Classroom Building at Silver Creek High School.  On April 9, 2009, the Board approved a Work Authorization for Aedis Group to perform design services. The project design team, including the site design oversight committee, has determined a need to provide an enhanced performance environment to accomodate visiting theatrical productions.  This requires specialized design efforts by theatrical and AV consultants beyond the established scope of services.  Due to this expanded scope of work, Board approval is sought to adjust the project scope to provide for these services.The Board approved multi-purpose total building budget of $14,496,520, which adequately covers the anticipated cost of services. The specialized services will be contracted through Aedis Group for a Fixed Fee.  This will require a new Work Authorization, which references services provided under the original Work Authorization.Facilities bond team will be present to answer questions from the Board of Trustees.FISCAL IMPACT:                                  NoneFUNDING SOURCE:Measure ERECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees 1) adopt the above recommendation to revise the project scope based on the description listed above, and 2) authorize the administration to contract consulting services through Aedis Group for a value not to exceed $110,000.
